definitions.definition: a short fight between two groups of people

examples.text: Clashes broke out between police and demonstrators.
Eight people were wounded in a clash with border guards.
Several people were injured in violent clashes with the police.

definitions.definition: an argument between two people or groups of people who have different beliefs and ideas
definitions.sensetop: clash (with somebody) (over something)clash (between A and B) (over something)

examples.text: There has been a head-on clash between the two candidates over education policy.
Differences in the aims of the two unions have led to serious clashes over policy.
The leaders are preparing for a head-on clash at the summit.

definitions.definition: the difference that exists between two things that are opposed to each other

examples.text: Simply put, the conflict comes down to a clash of cultures.
Personality clashes led to the break-up of the band.

definitions.definition: a situation in which two events happen at the same time so that you cannot go to or see them both
a loud noise made by two metal objects being hit together
an occasion when two teams or players compete against each other

examples.text: Bayern’s clash with Roma in the Champions League

definitions.definition: the situation when two colours, designs, etc. look ugly when they are put together
